![](http://elink.turing.ac.uk/o/4/eyJhaSI6NTkyMDc5NzIsImUiOiJ2aGVsbG9uQHR1cmluZy5hYy51ayIsInJpIjoiY29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi1mMzUxMDJlZTVhYTA0YWIxYWI3YmUxMTBmODI1YzJiOCIsInJxIjoicDEtYjIzMzQ3LWIzZjBhODgxNjJiZDQ2NjdiMWExZjE4YWVkMWQ1Nzk4IiwicGgiOm51bGx9/k0bTy2RiXqdnThAbd83J_A)

Click [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fm%2F1%2F59207972%2Fp1-b23347-b3f0a88162bd4667b1a1f18aed1d5798%2F1%2F191%2F519f05d8-930b-41ad-91a4-35fe0afa70e8&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C54f783948d2249ef7b9408dbfbdc4f04%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638380695904382913%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=67otLvNZ8o57sb45EH7yi%2Bi9Mw2k4s3h4nDxDRXxvUY%3D&reserved=0) if you are having trouble viewing this message.

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/bannernewsletter.png)

Welcome to December's Turing-Roche newsletter! We hope you're looking forward to the upcoming holiday season. Here you can find what's new in the Turing-Roche strategic partnership and opportunities, events and news from both The Alan Turing Institute, Roche and beyond.

Our [five year partnership](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FgknAJTXb6nctkgRxLUxcMQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C54f783948d2249ef7b9408dbfbdc4f04%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638380695904539193%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=MbWmnxk%2BJ0mcR59kv3uCRlMAQKecSolUuW2eWQafxgw%3D&reserved=0) was set up officially in June 2021 following a successful [Data Study Group](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FTyrq92l2cJdHvgfQ8UlGBQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C54f783948d2249ef7b9408dbfbdc4f04%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638380695904539193%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=kNTuGf4WTdmAua%2FxYTKPFfLoiIlQ%2BroFIpH%2FaHCQ3WI%3D&reserved=0) and a 12 week research project on lung cancer treatment. Our 'North Star' is **to enable the generation of insights to better understand patient and disease heterogeneity and its relevance to clinical outcomes at an unprecedented level of precision in order to improve clinical care.**

We will be covering multiple activities over the five years to work towards our North Star, as well as building strong connections and collaborations between the Alan Turing Institute, Roche and the wider community.

If you have anything you'd like featured in a future newsletter then please get in touch with Vicky Hellon, Community Manager for the partnership at <vhellon@turing.ac.uk>

If you would like to share this newsletter with relevant colleagues please direct them to sign-up [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FvpXV7kgel-XIfMww2jjVdQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C54f783948d2249ef7b9408dbfbdc4f04%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638380695904539193%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=7mX1VD0s%2BH0DgWbUpKkreWbo1uVH1g69xCijOZkF614%3D&reserved=0).


## Turing-Roche Strategic Partnership Updates

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/photo-1457530378978-8bac673b8062.jfif)

### Partnership is winner at Praxis Auril 2023 Knowledge Exchange Awards

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/keawards.png)

We're really excited to announce the partnership was the winner in the 'Strategic Partnership' category at the [Praxis Auril 2023 Knowledge Exchange Awards](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2Fa7iNrXp6Kq9BXVOZmu362A&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C54f783948d2249ef7b9408dbfbdc4f04%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638380695904539193%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=l2Aiim1A5n5PnrH3zK13vQP2waOfC55TDhWRh6C26sA%3D&reserved=0). The partnership team travelled to the award ceremony held in Leeds on the 23 November, which celebrated 'the many individuals and teams that create sustained impact from the UK's world-class research base.'

Turing's Partnerships Development Lead Katrina Payne accepted the award on the team's behalf. She noted that "the Chair of the judging panel's words were 'they don't get more strategic than this!'. Our success in this highly competitive category is a strong endorsement of the Turing-Roche partnership and of the valuable route from innovation to impact which it represents."

### Knowledge Share Series Event: Transparent AI for Healthcare

**30 January 2023**

Join us for our [partnership knowledge share series](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2F4_4vK2ewinECLJmybh1_kQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C54f783948d2249ef7b9408dbfbdc4f04%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638380695904539193%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=cvarC8ENd1NghWxLECFglrSvuygoWSLypdm%2B5Djymnw%3D&reserved=0). Our aim is to bring together members of the Turing and Roche networks and the wider scientific community to hear partnership research updates and share different academic and industry perspectives on areas related to patient/treatment heterogeneity and data science more generally.

After a December break we will be resuming our monthly events in January. The event is on the 30th and we will be hearing from our partnership Senior Research Associate Rohan Chakraborty on the topic of transparency in AI. You can register for the event [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPWI0VWl0Y21EWmQxekRMVEwxQmlVcWJGR3lDYjRwN0VjeU93UUhWTHhSZGZtbzc1UmwxT3pzXzBuaUJTalJlUEYmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi1mMzUxMDJlZTVhYTA0YWIxYWI3YmUxMTBmODI1YzJiOCZlc2lkPTAyMWZjYzI0LTFhOTUtZWUxMS1iZTM3LTYwNDViZGQxMzU5ZCJ9%2FWyTejN3b5hJeEUbqrhGv7A&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C54f783948d2249ef7b9408dbfbdc4f04%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638380695904539193%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=A5Kubq9YEI2cReWWi0e0pdPyKfADPCetK956I%2FcUsUM%3D&reserved=0). 

You can catch-up on previous recordings of our events at our [YouTube channel](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FjtgRRSOFhfLyktBN2B-knQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C54f783948d2249ef7b9408dbfbdc4f04%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638380695904539193%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=7WRp4NTINDdOwHFggibB586XbpypG6DMBqJtfsWXL0A%3D&reserved=0).

### Partnership paper on Network Embedding published in Journal of Physics: Complexity

Our Structured Missingness funded project team Anthony Baptista, Ginestra Bianconi and Ruben Sanchez-Garcia along with their colleagues have published a [review paper](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPWI0VWl0Y21EWmQxekRMVEwxQmlVcWJGR3lDYjRwN0VjeU93UUhWTHhSZGZtbzc1UmwxT3pzXzBuaUJTalJlUEYmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi1mMzUxMDJlZTVhYTA0YWIxYWI3YmUxMTBmODI1YzJiOCZlc2lkPTAyMWZjYzI0LTFhOTUtZWUxMS1iZTM3LTYwNDViZGQxMzU5ZCJ9%2F1GKjKR0MB4ECT5t4I2TQQg&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C54f783948d2249ef7b9408dbfbdc4f04%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638380695904539193%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=52Rl2sQSFO0xXgoXImRN5gUmW6YdpnrkGN5Egze%2BPpI%3D&reserved=0) in the Journal of Physics: Complexity. The paper provides a user-friendly guide to the network embedding literature and current trends in this field, helping readers to navigate through the complex landscape of methods and approaches emerging from the vibrant research activity on these subjects.

### Senior Partnership Postdoctoral Research Associate Rohan Chakraborty attending Global Partnership on AI Summit 2023

Turing-Roche Senior Postdoctoral Research Associate Dr Tapabrata Rohan Chakraborty has been invited as an expert panelist for Responsible AI at the [Global Partnership on Artificial Intelligence (GPAI) summit](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FGR2N16_-y1JAaP9yXahJhw&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C54f783948d2249ef7b9408dbfbdc4f04%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638380695904539193%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=kszXxJ6f%2BIyjzFf5xtAFvawylKVU75bYw%2BKjK3hSR4g%3D&reserved=0) in New Delhi. GPAI is a multi-stakeholder initiative of global experts bridging AI theory and practice and promoting research and practical efforts across science, industry, civil society, and governments.

Rohan recently co-authored [a paper](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPWI0VWl0Y21EWmQxekRMVEwxQmlVcWJGR3lDYjRwN0VjeU93UUhWTHhSZGZtbzc1UmwxT3pzXzBuaUJTalJlUEYmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi1mMzUxMDJlZTVhYTA0YWIxYWI3YmUxMTBmODI1YzJiOCZlc2lkPTAyMWZjYzI0LTFhOTUtZWUxMS1iZTM3LTYwNDViZGQxMzU5ZCJ9%2F1YNnXebAi1cjBCCQflbcpA&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C54f783948d2249ef7b9408dbfbdc4f04%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638380695904695468%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=pirraCZQecx0pL%2BzFWqwaUHrbxJ%2F0i71S5uY5YICyzU%3D&reserved=0) with Turing awardee Prof Yoshua Bengio on safety of foundation models, which led to his invitiation. 

Rohan will share his experiences with the community after the summit. 

### Partnership Postdoctoral Research Associate Anthony Baptista presents at Complex Networks Conference

Our structured missingness Postdoctoral Research Associate Anthony Baptista recently travelled to Menton Riviera in France to present at the Complex Networks conference 2023.

Anthony said 'The conference provided an excellent opportunity to showcase our collaborative research with Ginestra Bianconi and Ruben Sanchez-Garcia, conducted within the partnership. The presentation of our results on the mining of triadic interactions in the context of structured missingness and gene expression was met with great enthusiasm and appreciation from the network community.'

## Current News and Opportunities from The Alan Turing Institute and Roche

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/group_study_working__0.jpg)

### PhD Student Presentations and Networking Event at the Turing Institute

**Registration deadline: 04 January 2023**

**Event: 26 January 2023**

As part of the 'Turing Connections' initiative, the Turing Institute is hosting a free event for PhD students across the UK. The event will feature student presentations, a networking session and complimentary lunch. Find out more and how to register [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FSu3Oj15CHc5uuSgE0xMERQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C54f783948d2249ef7b9408dbfbdc4f04%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638380695904695468%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=v33bkk8%2FIpHQz7oRu7B9CuTrR4RT6rRJatM%2F7DU6XIc%3D&reserved=0).

### Roche Job Opportunities

Roche has a number of relevant job opportunities open this month. These include:

-   A [Data Science Apprentice](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FVlI9OYsY9A_h28zy7jJ6zA&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C54f783948d2249ef7b9408dbfbdc4f04%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638380695904695468%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=xMnziHaASxs8t8kqXXr9VK5b0gGqq2dYIcsti%2F6LI9k%3D&reserved=0) in the Product Development Data Sciences team in Welwyn, contributing to the development of our medicines, specifically the analysis, reporting and submission of clinical trial patient data.
-   A [Pharmacokinetic/Pharmacodynamic (PK/PD) Data Scientist](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPWI0VWl0Y21EWmQxekRMVEwxQmlVcWJGR3lDYjRwN0VjeU93UUhWTHhSZGZtbzc1UmwxT3pzXzBuaUJTalJlUEYmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi1mMzUxMDJlZTVhYTA0YWIxYWI3YmUxMTBmODI1YzJiOCZlc2lkPTAyMWZjYzI0LTFhOTUtZWUxMS1iZTM3LTYwNDViZGQxMzU5ZCJ9%2F3BhSynts0bLY9Q0IVzOM8A&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C54f783948d2249ef7b9408dbfbdc4f04%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638380695904695468%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=a24uwVoXnB%2F3rMnQaZsQ3%2B%2BsY1lp0uVLpMMqCFopqmA%3D&reserved=0) located in the Predictive Modeling and Data Analytics chapter, a chapter within the Pharmaceutical Sciences function, where generating insights from data is a primary focus area.
-   [Biostatistics PhD Summer Internship Scheme](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPWI0VWl0Y21EWmQxekRMVEwxQmlVcWJGR3lDYjRwN0VjeU93UUhWTHhSZGZtbzc1UmwxT3pzXzBuaUJTalJlUEYmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi1mMzUxMDJlZTVhYTA0YWIxYWI3YmUxMTBmODI1YzJiOCZlc2lkPTAyMWZjYzI0LTFhOTUtZWUxMS1iZTM3LTYwNDViZGQxMzU5ZCJ9%2FzB_XqHacpBwNPm3P0e7OcQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C54f783948d2249ef7b9408dbfbdc4f04%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638380695904695468%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=EA0Qjp1IiLFwkdT8qzBA%2BTQQsWajkwb5t5Qm1%2BAYvco%3D&reserved=0) for Summer 2024. The successful summer interns will work for 10 weeks at our Roche Welwyn site under the supervision of experienced data scientists and will receive a competitive salary. Interns will work on theoretical or applied problems with direct relevance to Roche's ongoing clinical drug-development in areas such as oncology, immunology, infectious disease, ophthalmology, or neuroscience.

### Applications Open for Turing Enrichment Scheme

**Application deadline: 17 January 2023**

Are you pursuing a PhD in data science or AI? Looking to expand your skills and connect with fellow researchers? The Turing Institute's PhD Enrichment Scheme is now open for applications.The programme provides 6 or 9 month placements at the Turing, surrounded by inspiring people breaking boundaries in technical fields. The placements are packed with opportunities to collaborate across disciplines, and learn new techniques and methodologies through specialised training. The scheme will begin in October 2024. Find out more and how to apply [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2F9UW3ooUQpU2fo87cUeV0yg&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C54f783948d2249ef7b9408dbfbdc4f04%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638380695904695468%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=U65lAsrRPDcdL%2FqTY8TPtuN3%2FcwODEHIsQsX1y8oTq0%3D&reserved=0).

## Events

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/ags-0057_800-px-wide.jpg)

### Statisticians in the Pharmaceutical Industry (PSI) Webinar: Causal Inference in Clinical Trials

**14 December 2023**

The second webinar in this series will take place on the 14th and is aimed for statisticians with an interest in understanding causal inference methods. The webinar will illustrate real practical applications in drug development using case studies of how such ideas can provide valuable understanding of the effects of treatments in the presence of intercurrent events or where effects may be mediated by intermediate factors. It features speakers from industry and academia, including Sean Yiu from Roche. Find out more and how to register [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPWI0VWl0Y21EWmQxekRMVEwxQmlVcWJGR3lDYjRwN0VjeU93UUhWTHhSZGZtbzc1UmwxT3pzXzBuaUJTalJlUEYmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi1mMzUxMDJlZTVhYTA0YWIxYWI3YmUxMTBmODI1YzJiOCZlc2lkPTAyMWZjYzI0LTFhOTUtZWUxMS1iZTM3LTYwNDViZGQxMzU5ZCJ9%2F08Jmp_aniV833CUJR8na1A&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C54f783948d2249ef7b9408dbfbdc4f04%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638380695904851719%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=NmXRElvO09%2FQrIdFZMiEAu%2FtGZTB6SxTBdtnvFTz18Y%3D&reserved=0).

### Data-driven Cancer Research Conference

**27-28 February 2023**

Cancer Research UK are launching an inaugural data-driven cancer research conference, which aims to celebrate the potential of cancer research data to drive discovery and innovation.\
The event is open to researchers from all career stages, working in or interested in cancer research, data science, bioinformatics, computational oncology, computer science, mathematics or statistics including those working at the interface between these disciplines. They also welcome clinicians and healthcare professionals, patients and patient advocates, other funders and industry representatives to attend and join the conversation around maximising the scientific value of health and research data. More information [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FZMWhJ4qYJX7HbJDXZ-mvHA&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C54f783948d2249ef7b9408dbfbdc4f04%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638380695904851719%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=ilSpSme4TbM96Kyr1aft11ij7eSer6IqphuguIEh1uo%3D&reserved=0).

### Conformal and Probalistic Prediction with Applications Symposium (COPA 2024)

**9-11 September 2024**

The 13th COPA Symposium will be held from the 9-11 September 2024 in Milan, Italy. The aim of this symposium is to serve as a forum for the presentation of new and ongoing work and the exchange of ideas between researchers on any aspect of conformal and probabilistic prediction, including their application to interesting problems in any field.\
Submissions are invited on original and previously unpublished research in this area. Further conference info [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2Fe5a_zHngHlolJeeR91vhyQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C54f783948d2249ef7b9408dbfbdc4f04%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638380695904851719%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=yngM5VRf3Y5NZy6EbBjdTZSSNhTxGHiyrAAKBz5mvI0%3D&reserved=0).

## Other Opportunities

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/alex-shutin-204369-unsplash.jpg)

### Funding Opportunity: Fairness Innovation Challenge

**Application deadline: 13 December 2023**

The Centre for Data Ethics and Innovation (CDEI) is launching a Fairness Innovation Challenge to drive the development of novel solutions to address bias and discrimination in AI systems. Winning solutions will implement socio-technical approaches to fairness, provide greater clarity about how different assurance techniques can be applied in practice, and test how strategies to address bias and discrimination in AI systems interact and can comply with relevant regulation. Proposals will receive grant funding to develop their solutions over a one-year period. Find out more [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2F8o8uj7bVXb3K20P8lud_Wg&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C54f783948d2249ef7b9408dbfbdc4f04%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638380695904851719%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=B2Gvpo6O3pmLB0DSuvKTaDVYxeAgR1ILlVWTGz%2Fwtpk%3D&reserved=0).

### PhD Studentships at the University of Cambridge

**Application deadline: 22 December 2023**

Two relevant 3-year PhD Studentships at the University of Cambridge are open for applications, both funded by Health Data Research UK.

One is in [Biomedical Data Science](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FTFG_mTrBI4HWWa5DeIoyyQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C54f783948d2249ef7b9408dbfbdc4f04%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638380695904851719%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=rHrNkoeKGDv9KANTOtPWjE8q8g%2FW4o0gC4QFw7PcvlI%3D&reserved=0), with the application of biomedical data science to understand the aetiologies of common diseases, create risk prediction models, and develop open computational tools and resources.

The other is in [Multi-omics in Population Cohorts](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FGobQprsqQyrKsnaXDkllRg&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C54f783948d2249ef7b9408dbfbdc4f04%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638380695905007994%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=QIVFfe7fBoRx3dHp8wy5WF2BX82NjjZZkbcMlzkIJ8o%3D&reserved=0), looking at combining multi-omics data data in multiple large-scale population cohorts to address questions relating to causes and predictors of common complex disease.

### Job Opportunities: Research Associate Roles for Turing-Sanger Partnership

**Application deadline: 31 December 2023**

Two roles are open for applications as Research Associates for the Turing-Sanger Partnership, a new collaboration where both institutes will work on a research project with the aim of advancing our understanding of cellular processes and interactions. The project will combine two important fields of study: machine learning and spatial / single-cell transcriptomics. The two positions open are a [Research Associate in Machine Learning](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2F2wYMPzouwYcX5kNpFRHEkg&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C54f783948d2249ef7b9408dbfbdc4f04%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638380695905007994%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=1IRNuHzgs7fxFQZj95WGUCRI0UgBgWrDUyiBRlkWOgM%3D&reserved=0) and a [Research Associate in Computational Biology](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FpxSAPc-_Zi_N_vVDT8BRFQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C54f783948d2249ef7b9408dbfbdc4f04%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638380695905007994%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=%2BeLsAvmdxHQ%2FCpMb%2F687EP%2FD9qjysHrmnyHdNXtlS%2BQ%3D&reserved=0).

### PhD Opportunities in Structured Missingness and Operationally feasible Multi-Arm-Bandit Response Adaptive Trials

**Application deadline: 08 January 2024 and 15 January 2024 (respectively)**

One of our partnership team members, [Dr Robin Mitra](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FHnzabt8ZXic4MCaWN-NaaQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C54f783948d2249ef7b9408dbfbdc4f04%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638380695905007994%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=buiY2hv7AL%2FHYnM7yXMYsGeoGeGGM%2BUDn0PSXj8An2I%3D&reserved=0) has two open PhD opportunities. 

One is based at University College London and is a project developing statistical methods to handle Structured Missingness in large complex databases- info [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FhsffBIKKdfjQk-7_ZlRUIQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C54f783948d2249ef7b9408dbfbdc4f04%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638380695905007994%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=OBRpcsOPg8XnPI7%2BRW%2FTrrRDEwl%2BwHr8P4GvE%2FFKn3k%3D&reserved=0).

The other project is on 'Operationally feasible Multi-Arm-Bandit Response Adaptive Trials' at the University of Cambridge and will be jointly supervised with Dr Sofia S. Villar and Mr Yaron Racah- info [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2F1SoKRnOFP5Iia_Um-RlhOg&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C54f783948d2249ef7b9408dbfbdc4f04%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638380695905007994%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=QDo8siI6Yx14PR6FGoaBwdZYguedjePCSBli1Gw4DgA%3D&reserved=0).

### Job Opportunity: Lecturer/Reader in Machine Learning

**Application deadline: 15 January 2024**

Applications are invited for an academic position in machine learning in the School of Informatics at the University of Edinburgh, one of the largest centres in Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence in Europe. The appointment will be full-time (35h per week) and open-ended (equivalent to a US tenured position). Candidates will have a research interest in principled approaches to machine learning, and/or the development of novel methods of wide applicability with state-of-the-art capability. Further info and how to apply [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FnHoGnYisx4qKxDiCajjjKA&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C54f783948d2249ef7b9408dbfbdc4f04%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638380695905007994%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=5nA4GT9ayH0UD%2FAWOBvCX9VhEL%2F3tzryjbwxudqJ6XA%3D&reserved=0).


## Featured Community Scholar of the Month

In September 2023 we welcomed our first cohort of Turing-Roche Community Scholars: 10 UK PhD students who are joining the partnership for 12 months to develop community-based projects for the partnership, alongside their ongoing PhD studies. Each month we are featuring a different scholar in our newsletter.

You can find out more about our community scholars [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2F89-X3HUqWDXtO-1-RgRdQQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C54f783948d2249ef7b9408dbfbdc4f04%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638380695905007994%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=98vHxQEtUA%2Bie9RTSVzm1d4efWFuTeC3mitmZpGjzdI%3D&reserved=0). You can also see more about their plans for their projects [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FxJNpzIo2tYzRo032aeN7nA&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C54f783948d2249ef7b9408dbfbdc4f04%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638380695905007994%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=EcqF310UegCM1K0i8D7sFTkpI%2FPB5ArrAUQ2a2pslmY%3D&reserved=0).

This month's scholar is Kuniko Paxton, from the University of Hull.

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/kuniko_paxton_0.jpg)

### Tell us a little bit about yourself and your current research:**

I am Kuniko Paxton, a PhD student at the University of Hull. I am originally from Japan. My research goal is to create a novel fairness evaluation framework in healthcare uniquely using the optimal transport theorem, statistical distance measures, and advanced explainability techniques. 

Unlike traditional methods, which often categorise sensitive attributes like skin colour and age into skin type and generation, we aim to introduce a more nuanced, continuous measure of fairness. This shift is crucial because, numerical characteristics like skin colour, eye colour, and size have been tricky to measure without oversimplifying them into categories.Moreover, current fairness assessment frameworks mainly focus on outcomes. It's time to broaden this perspective. Our approach is unique in that it also considers behaviour, providing insights into the causes of unfairness. To do this, we're integrating advanced explainability-fairness techniques like LIME and SMILE into our research.

This research isn't just theoretical; it has profound practical implications. We understand and address biases from both outcome and behavioural perspectives by employing advanced explainability techniques like SMILE. This approach marks a significant shift towards personalised healthcare, ensuring AI models cater to individual needs rather than just the majority, leading to a more equitable healthcare system.\
For future work, we could also step into causality consideration and appraise fairness against adversarial attacks from a model weakness perspective.

### What is your planned community scholar project? Why is this of interest to you? 

My project is centered around launching an engaging interview series that brings the heart of the partnership research to life. This series isn't just informative; it's designed to be thoroughly entertaining, making complex ideas accessible and captivating. It aims to ignite passion and curiosity among a diverse audience, particularly those just starting their research careers by featuring dialogues with leading research experts.\
What excites me most about this project is the opportunity to delve deeper into the minds of these renowned experts. It's not just about understanding their techniques and methods but also gaining insights into their philosophies and ideologies, which are often the catalysts for groundbreaking ideas. Plus, I'm eager to see how they tackle our most challenging questions. This could reveal a different, perhaps more personal side of these distinguished figures, adding a unique dimension to our understanding of their work.

### What is your favourite meal- breakfast, lunch or dinner?

My favourite meal is my breakfast: pancakes. Although I experienced skipping my breakfast for a while, I found that a meal in the morning is vital for me.  So, I began breakfast experiments. At first, it was smoothies, but after two weeks, I came to want to eat something other than a drink. Next was almond croissants. Forgetting to buy them repeatedly and being expensive to get them at cafes made me give up. Then, pancakes. So far, they are my favourite. Once a week or so, I cook many pancakes with collagen and kale powders, less sugar than the recipe, and then freeze them. Every morning, I put one of them in my microwave. It makes me feel healthier and more cost-efficient. Honestly, I know it is suspicious how much it is healthy as more than 10% of ingredients are sugar, though!


## Publication of the Month

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/patrick-tomasso-oaqk7qqnh_c-unsplash2.jpg)

### Explaining black boxes with a SMILE: Statistical Model-agnostic Interpretability with Local Explanations

Alongside our new partnership paper on networks (see above), this month's publication of the month is [this paper](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FKOc9-Q73DqcXOxOt6HT22w&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C54f783948d2249ef7b9408dbfbdc4f04%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638380695905007994%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=2vtmTHWCzznLApHDX7Sa9RmLBUBCN2thfAUtNdne8P0%3D&reserved=0), chosen by our featured Community Scholar Kuniko Paxton.

'The Statistical Model-agnostic Interpretability with Local Explanations (SMILE) method, recently proposed by Aslansefat et al. from our research group at the University of Hull's School of Computer Science, represents a significant advancement in AI explainability techniques. This innovative approach focuses on utilising statistical distance measures to more effectively depict the impact of various features on AI model predictions. A key strength of SMILE lies in its ability to enhance explanatory consistency and accuracy. It achieves this by minimising the influence of abrupt discontinuities in input data, which often lead to misleading interpretations.

Crucially, SMILE has been validated and shown to surpass the LIME family and SHAP in terms of the quality of explainability it offers. This paper introduces a novel concept: explainability coverage estimations, specifically for image classification tasks. These estimations are instrumental in my research, which aims to uncover and address issues of fairness in AI systems through improved explainability. This method not only enhances our understanding of AI decision-making processes but also contributes significantly to the development of more transparent and equitable AI systems.'
